cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with video representation, which is a key challenge in computer vision applications. The proposed approach involves computing optical flow and using it in a least squares optimization to find a new image, the Flow Profile Image (FPI), which encodes motion and appearance information. This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, it involves machine learning techniques such as optimization and validation experiments, which are relevant to the Machine Learning (cs.MM) and Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The paper also deals with information retrieval and classification, which are relevant to the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a novel approach for video representation, which involves capturing meaningful information from a sequence of video frames and compacting it into a single image, which is relevant to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category.
